snippet.title: How Volcanoes Work
snippet.description: Volcanoes are some of nature's most awe-inspiring displays, with everything from exploding mountaintops to rivers of lava. Learn how all.. the different types of volcanoes work. See more volcano pictures. Volcano Image Gallery Whenever there is a major volcanic eruption in the world, you'll­ see...

snippet.title: How Volcanoes Work: Eruption Frequency
snippet.description: Eruption frequency is how scientists determine how active a given volcano is. Find out how scientists study eruption frequency and see pictures.. interesting structures, such as calderas and lava domes. Calderas, large crater-shaped basins, form when eruptions drain a magma chamber and the volcano edifice...

snippet.title: Introduction to The Biggest Eruptions on Earth

snippet.title: How Volcanoes Work: Types of Eruptions
snippet.description: Types of eruptions include fissure eruptions, hydrovolcanic eruptions, and Plinian eruptions. Find out how the types of eruptions differ from each..A tall Plinian plume erupts from Klyuchevskaya Volcano in Russia. Photo courtesy NASA Within these two broad eruption categories, there are several...

snippet.title: How Volcanoes Work: Magma Eruptions
snippet.description: Magma eruptions are caused by internal gas pressure that forces the magma to the surface. Learn about magma eruptions and see pictures of magma.. they push a lot of the soda out with them. This is true for volcanoes as well. As the bubbles escape, they push the magma out, causing a spewing eruption...

snippet.title: How Volcanoes Work: Other Types of Eruptions
snippet.description: Other types of eruptions include vulcanian eruptions, hydrovolcanic eruptions and fissure eruptions. Learn about these volcanic eruptions.... Vulcanian eruptions generally aren't associated with lava flow. A hydrovolcanic eruption from Ukinrek Volcano, off the coast of Alaska. Photo courtesy USGS...

snippet.title: How Volcanoes Work: Volcano Formation
snippet.description: Volcano formation is the result of an eruption at a hot spot at a particular point on the Earth.
